definitions: relating to or characteristic of the north-central United States region
examples: The midwestern states experience harsh winters and humid summers
His midwestern values emphasized hard work and community

definitions: having or showing great strength, power, or force
extremely large, impressive, or important in degree or extent
examples: The mighty river carved deep canyons through solid rock
Ancient civilizations feared the mighty warriors from the north
That was a mighty fine performance at the concert
The mighty oak tree had stood for centuries

definitions: relating to people or animals that move from one place to another
examples: Migrant workers harvest crops throughout the growing season
The migrant bird population arrives each spring

definitions: relating to or characterized by regular movement from one region to another
examples: Migratory birds travel thousands of miles each year
The tribe maintained their migratory lifestyle for centuries

definitions: not severe, serious, or harsh in nature or effect
having a soft, gentle taste without strong or sharp flavors
gentle and not easily provoked to anger or excitement
examples: The doctor prescribed mild painkillers for her headache
We enjoyed mild weather throughout our vacation
This cheese has a mild flavor perfect for sandwiches
She prefers mild salsa without too much spice
His mild manner made him popular with the children
Despite the provocation, she gave a mild response

definitions: combative and aggressive in support of a political or social cause
examples: The militant protesters blocked the government building entrance
Her militant stance on environmental issues alienated moderates

definitions: believing in or pursuing an aggressive military policy and glorifying military values
examples: The militaristic regime increased defense spending dramatically
His militaristic approach to management created workplace tension

definitions: equipped with military forces or given military character and discipline
examples: The militarized zone remains heavily guarded at all times
Police departments have become increasingly militarized over the years

definitions: relating to or characteristic of soldiers or armed forces
examples: Military personnel receive specialized combat training each year
The president announced new military spending in the budget

definitions: containing milk or resembling milk in consistency or taste
having a pale white color or cloudy appearance like milk
examples: The coffee had a milky taste from too much cream
She preferred milky tea to black coffee
The milky glass diffused the harsh sunlight beautifully
His eyes had a milky appearance due to cataracts

definitions: processed by grinding, cutting, or crushing in a mill
examples: The milled flour produced finer bread than hand-ground
Precision milled parts ensure perfect fit in machinery

definitions: relating to a period of a thousand years or anniversary
relating to the generation born between 1981 and 1996
examples: The church celebrated its millennial anniversary with special services
Ancient texts predicted millennial changes in human society
Millennial workers value flexibility and work-life balance
The millennial generation faces unique economic challenges

definitions: amounting to one million in number or being the millionth
examples: The million dollar prize attracted thousands of contestants
This was her million dollar idea for the company

definitions: constituting number one million in a sequence or one of a million equal parts
examples: She was the millionth visitor to the museum
He calculated the answer to the millionth decimal place

definitions: characterized by or involving imitation of something else
examples: The robot's mimic behavior fooled observers into thinking it was human
Children often display mimic responses to adult expressions

definitions: having a particular type of mind or attitude as specified
inclined or disposed to do something or think in a certain way
examples: The open minded professor welcomed challenging questions from students
She was always civic minded about community issues
I'm not minded to accept their offer without negotiation
The committee seemed minded to approve the proposal

definitions: conscious or aware of something and taking it into careful consideration
examples: Remain mindful of your breathing during meditation exercises
The company is mindful of its environmental responsibilities

definitions: done without conscious thought or requiring no mental effort
showing a complete lack of intelligence or good judgment
examples: The mindless repetition of tasks left workers feeling unfulfilled
Mindless violence erupted after the controversial verdict
It was a mindless mistake that cost them the game
His mindless comments offended everyone at the meeting

definitions: obtained by digging or excavating from the earth
examples: The mined diamonds underwent careful quality inspection processes
Mined coal still powers many electricity plants worldwide

definitions: relating to or containing naturally occurring inorganic substances
examples: Mineral water contains dissolved salts from underground sources
The soil needs mineral supplements for healthy plant growth

definitions: smaller than normal in size, especially a miniature version
examples: The mini refrigerator fits perfectly in the dorm room
She drives a mini cooper through city traffic

definitions: much smaller than normal, especially being a small-scale model or version
examples: The miniature train set included incredibly detailed buildings
She collected miniature books that fit in her palm

definitions: of a minimum amount, quantity, or degree; barely adequate or smallest possible
examples: The storm caused minimal damage to coastal properties
She prefers minimal makeup for a natural look

definitions: characterized by extreme simplicity and using the fewest elements possible
examples: Her minimalist apartment contained only essential furniture pieces
The minimalist design emphasized clean lines and empty space

definitions: reduced to the smallest possible amount, extent, or degree
examples: The minimized window appeared as an icon on the taskbar
Risks were minimized through careful planning and preparation

definitions: being the least or smallest amount or quantity possible or required
examples: The job requires minimum qualifications of a bachelor's degree
Employees must meet minimum performance standards each quarter

definitions: relating to a government minister or religious ministry
relating to routine administrative duties requiring no special discretion
examples: The ministerial meeting addressed urgent policy matters this morning
Ministerial duties include overseeing departmental operations
She performed ministerial tasks like filing and data entry
The decision was purely ministerial with no discretion involved

definitions: lesser in importance, seriousness, or significance than others
under the age of full legal responsibility
relating to a musical scale with a semitone between second and third notes
examples: The accident caused only minor injuries to the passengers
She made minor adjustments to improve the design
Alcohol cannot be sold to minor children under eighteen
The court appointed a guardian for the minor defendant
The song shifts from major to minor key dramatically
Bach's minor fugues convey deep emotional intensity

definitions: in perfect condition as if new or unused
having the fresh, cool flavor or scent of mint
examples: The mint condition comic book sold for thousands of dollars
She kept her vintage car in mint condition
The mint toothpaste left her breath feeling fresh
He ordered mint chocolate chip ice cream

definitions: having the taste, smell, or qualities of mint
examples: The minty freshness lasted hours after brushing teeth
She enjoyed the minty cocktail on the summer evening

definitions: extremely small or so small as to be almost negligible
examples: The minuscule text required a magnifying glass to read
Her minuscule apartment barely fit a bed and desk

definitions: so small as to be barely visible or negligible
characterized by painstaking attention to precise details
examples: Minute particles of dust floated in the sunlight
The difference in color was minute but noticeable
Her minute examination revealed previously hidden flaws
The contract required minute attention to every clause

definitions: occurring through divine intervention or extraordinarily amazing and unlikely
examples: The patient made a miraculous recovery against all odds
Their miraculous escape from the fire amazed everyone

definitions: stuck or trapped in a difficult or unpleasant situation
examples: The company remains mired in debt despite restructuring efforts
The nation was mired in political scandal for months

definitions: covered with or having a surface that reflects like a mirror
exactly reproduced or duplicated as if reflected in a mirror
examples: The mirrored walls made the room appear twice its size
She wore mirrored sunglasses to the beach
His expression mirrored the confusion everyone else felt
The data showed mirrored patterns across both groups

definitions: dishonestly or unfairly taken for one's own use without permission
examples: The misappropriated funds were traced to offshore accounts
Misappropriated company resources led to his immediate termination

definitions: consisting of diverse things or members of various types grouped together
examples: The garage sale featured miscellaneous household items and tools
She filed miscellaneous receipts in a separate folder

definitions: showing a fondness for causing trouble in a playful way
intended to cause harm or trouble in a malicious way
examples: The mischievous child hid his sister's favorite toy
Her mischievous smile suggested she was planning something
The mischievous rumors damaged his reputation significantly
Someone spread mischievous lies about the company

definitions: wretchedly unhappy, uncomfortable, or in a state of suffering
causing unhappiness, discomfort, or wretchedness
of very poor quality or shamefully inadequate
examples: She felt miserable after hearing the devastating news
The sick child looked miserable with fever
The miserable weather ruined our vacation plans completely
Working conditions in the factory were absolutely miserable
They paid miserable wages for such demanding work
The team's miserable performance disappointed their fans

definitions: having or showing faulty judgment or reasoning based on wrong information
examples: His misguided attempt to help only made things worse
The misguided policy failed to address the real problems

definitions: having an incorrect or misleading label or description attached
examples: The mislabeled products were recalled from store shelves immediately
Mislabeled medication can cause serious health risks

definitions: giving the wrong idea or impression and causing someone to believe something false
examples: The misleading advertisement prompted consumer complaints and investigations
His misleading statements confused the jury during testimony

definitions: not matching or corresponding in pattern, color, style, or characteristics
examples: She wore mismatched socks as a quirky fashion statement
The mismatched couple surprised everyone with their compatibility

definitions: showing dislike, contempt, or ingrained prejudice against women
examples: His misogynistic comments sparked outrage on social media
The company's misogynistic culture prevented women from advancing

definitions: put in the wrong place or position
inappropriate, unjustified, or directed at the wrong target
examples: The misplaced file delayed the entire project completion
Several misplaced items turned up during spring cleaning
His misplaced anger hurt innocent family members
Their misplaced confidence led to poor decisions

definitions: given a false or misleading account or impression of something
examples: The misrepresented data skewed the research conclusions significantly
She felt her views were misrepresented in the article

definitions: failed to hit, reach, catch, or make contact with
not present at or failing to attend
felt the loss or absence of someone or something
examples: The missed opportunity haunted him for years afterward
Three missed calls appeared on her phone screen
His missed classes resulted in failing the course
The missed appointment had to be rescheduled
She was a much missed member of our community
The missed connection left them wondering what if

definitions: not in the expected or proper place; absent
unable to be found or having disappeared
examples: The report had several missing pages that needed replacing
Two students were missing from class today
Police searched for the missing child throughout the night
The missing jewelry was never recovered

definitions: relating to or characteristic of religious missions or missionaries
examples: The missionary work brought education to remote villages
She devoted her life to missionary service overseas

definitions: wrong in one's opinion, judgment, or understanding about something
examples: You're mistaken about the time of the meeting
His mistaken belief cost the company millions
